CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, September 29, 1962, pg. 32 reads: "Mustangs Receive Awards - Shown above are some of the persons who attended a program of the Gateway Athletic Mustangs, at 626 Herron Ave., last week. Left to right, first row: Lonnie Spraggins, manager; Edward Harris, William Jackson, Robert McClendon, Robert Peoples, Richard Coleman, David Roberts and James Boswell.  Second row: Lloyd Hartwell, Alvey Dearmint, Joe Taylor, Ronald Golightly, Thomas Barnes and La Wanna Morris.  Third row: Marie Bennett, mistress of ceremonies; Paul Dykes, youth secretary of the Centre Avenue YMCA; John Brewer, Miller School principal, and Charles (Chuck) Cooper of the Urban LEague. - Harris PHoto."
TitMainTitle: Group portrait from left, first row: Lonnie Spraggins, Edward Harris, William Jackson, Robert McClendon, Robert Peoples, Richard Coleman, David Roberts, and James Boswell; second row: Lloyd Hartwell, Alvey Dearmint, Joe Taylor, Ronald Golightly, Thomas Barnes, and La Wanna Morris; third row: Marie Bennett, Paul Dykes, John Brewer, and Charles (Chuck) Cooper, posed in church with St. Frances Choir banner on choir stall and figurative religious statues on altar for program of the Gateway Athletic Mustangs
